intro: Nonea vesicaria, commonly known as the bladderleaf or blisterleaf, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive, rounded leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Nonea vesicaria is often found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its unique leaf shape and medicinal properties have made it of interest to botanists and herbalists alike.
